duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with physicists, engineers and technicians on various project phases including initial concept, engineering analysis, detailed design, integration, fabrication procurement assembly, testing, installation, and commissioning of superconducting magnets.
Partner with subject matter experts to design and/or operate cryogenic systems and conduct electromagnetic, structural, and thermal analyses on existing or new superconducting magnets.
Create magnet designs based on high temperatures and/or low-temperature superconductors for prescribed requirements of field strength, uniformity, and other operating conditions.
Model components or systems utilizing commercial finite element software (ANSYS, COMSOL) and document engineering designs through written reports and presentation materials.

Provide a deep understanding in electromagnetic theory and real-world design & specification of magnetic components, coupled electromagnetic environments in in the radio frequency and millimeter wave bands.
Operate under a culture of teamwork to overcome challenging design tasks while maintaining awareness of individual strengths and weaknesses.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering, or mathematics (Master's preferred)
